results.title: One wild weekend with the lonesome rustler
results.creator_credit: Julie Money, Chris Fitchett, Kylie Burke, Australian Film Commission and JAM Productions
results.brief_description: Hermione, a laundromat worker from Baulkham Hill, and her friend Joeline, decide to hit the road and head for Tamworth for the annual rodeo show. Hermione has an absolute obsession for all that is Texan and so when she meets Alfie John Morrison, champion bull rider, country and western singer and part Texan, Hermione is totally swept off her feet - all her dreams have come true. Joeline, in the meantime, has paired off with Buddy L, new up and coming rodeo champion. This charming romantic comedy with its occasional black moments and its tongue-in-cheek look at the Australian rodeo scene was a finalist in the Sydney Film Festival and won an award at the St Kilda Film Festival. Cast includes Ruth Caro, Helen Buday, Lorna Lesley, Justin Monjo, Todd Boyce.

results.title: One week at a time
results.creator_credit: Jaime Browne and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: Having failed to win one game in their last three years of competition, the once great Albion Football Club is facing removal from the Melbourne District Football League. The one remaining chance for the Western suburbs team to avoid this fate is to win their last game of the season against top Eastern suburbs team Malvern - an impossible feat. When ex-Albion player Bunner - who was banned from playing football fifteen years earlier because of his violent behaviour - hears of the club’s plight, he decides to take extreme action. A parochial comedy about class differences in district footy and the joys of winning against all odds. Cast includes Michael Robinson, Andy McPhee, Damien Walshe-Howling, Natalie Carr.

results.title: Danube interlude
results.creator_credit: Greg Grainger, Australian Television Network, Grainger Maynard and MTV HUngary
results.brief_description: This is compelling viewing, documenting a communist country as it undergoes profound changes. The program traces the breakdown of the communist system, watching Soviet soldiers withdraw for the first time since the Popular Uprising of 1956. “Danube interlude” shows Hungary at its most majestic, from a gentle trip down the Danube River to a ride on the famous Lippizan horses in the Bukk National Park.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Grainger, Australian Television Network, Grainger Maynard and MTV HUngary

results.title: One way street = Les Naufrages du quartier
results.creator_credit: Bernard Longpre, Rene Jodoin, Robert Forget and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Alcoholism is the subject of this animated film. Stark line drawings portray the vicious cycle of drinking and family break-up, as the head of a family drinks to forget the drudgery of his life. The consequences are disastrous. A film without words in which images speak volumes. (Award: Cork)

results.title: One way or another = De cierta manera
results.creator_credit: Sara Gomez, Camilo Vives and Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC)
results.brief_description: One Way or Another is a provocative and challenging feature-length dramatic film on the subject of human relations, particularly relations between the sexes. The story takes place in 1962, during the early years of the Cuban revolution. It is set in Miraflores, a new housing district built and inhabited by former residents of a shanty-town just outside Havana. The film reveals the difficulties faced by the formerly marginal sector of the population (previously consigned to lives of poverty, chronic unemployment, illiteracy and disease) in integrating into the socially productive life of the new society. Further complicating their development is the persistence of outdated traditions and beliefs, such as animistic religions, an exaggerated individualism, rampant sexism, and a “male code of honour” between friends. The story focuses on the personal relationships between three protagonists: Yolanda, a young, middle-class schoolteacher who fully identifies with the revolution and who tries, not without difficulties, to put its ideas into practice in both her professional and her private life; Mario, a young worker raised in the slums whose romantic relationship with Yolanda becomes the testing ground for his realization of the need for new attitudes and his difficulty in breaking with his old, macho ways; and Humberto, Mario’s friend, who has nominally accepted the revolution but still tries to live by the old ways. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Danny's egg
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Michael Midlam and PBL Productions
results.brief_description: The story of Danny, a young boy living in an Australian country town, who discovers a emu’s egg and sets about ensuring that it hatches. Danny is thwarted by the school mischief-maker but manages to incubate the egg. Provides a delightful look at the diverse skills required of the country teacher and the lifestyle of country schoolchildren. Written by David Haythornthwaite from a story by Jim Badger. Cast includes Ken Talbot as Danny. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Jane Eyre. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Julian Amyes, Barry Letts and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This adaptation of Charlotte Bronte’s novel stars Timothy Dalton as the brusque Mr. Rochester and Zelah Clarke as the small but ‘independently spirited’ Jane. Jane leaves Lowood school, a charitable institute where she has spent the last eight years of her life, and secures a position at Thornfield Hall as a governess - in the employ of the mysterious Mr. Rochester.

results.title: Jane Eyre by Charlotte Bronte
results.creator_credit: Robert Young, Greg Brenman and LWT
results.brief_description: Samantha Morton stars as Charlotte Bronte’s young orphaned girl, Jane Eyre, who takes the position of governess to the daughter of the mysterious Edward Rochester (Ciaran Hinds), master of a large and eerie house on the Yorkshire Moors - Thornfield Hall. Will she receive the same harsh treatment she has always known as a child - or will she find the love she has always longed for? And what dark secret lies hidden at the top of the house? Cast also includes Gemma Jones, Timia Berthome and Blanche Ingramas. This made for television feature is the tenth screen adaptation of the famous novel.

results.title: Jane Eyre
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Dyson Lovell, Cineritmo, Flach Film and Rochester Films
results.brief_description: Jane Eyre has lived a sad life since she was orphaned as a child. Shuffled between relatives and boarding school, she has never really known love. However, when she takes the job of governess to the illegitimate ward of nobleman, Edward Rochester, she experiences warmth and security for the very first time. When she and Rochester fall in love and he proposes marriage, it seems that finally, she will know happiness - until a devastating secret threatens to destroy the one thing she so desperately desires. Cast includes William Hurt, Charlotte Gainsbourg, Joan Plowright, Anna Paquin and Elle MacPherson. This is an enthralling love story based on the classic novel by Charlotte Bronte.

results.title: Jane Eyre. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Julian Amyes, Barry Letts and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Having fled Thornfield and Rochester, Jane is taken in and cared for by the handsome young clergyman St John Rivers and his sisters, Diana and Mary. Finally Jane is confronted with her most testing challenge - to accept St John Rivers’ offer to join him as his wife and fellow missionary or to return to Thornfield Hall and seek future happiness with Mr Rochester.
